name: Circular Meadow Mobility Trail & Linear Duncombe Terrace Mobility Trail, Ashridge Estate

ai.summary: An interconnected 10.9 km route that combines Circular Meadow Mobility Trail with Linear Duncombe Terrace Mobility Trail at Ashridge Estate. This moderate, ridge-focused hike traverses chalk hills, open meadows and shaded woodlands, delivering expansive views and a varied surface suitable for walkers seeking a relaxed yet engaging outing.
ai.terrain_summary: The terrain is a mix of well-maintained gravel paths, compact forest tracks and grassy woodland edges. Expect gentle to moderate climbs along ridges, with occasional steeper or uneven sections and the potential for mud after rain. Some stretches are exposed on ridge tops, while others pass through shady woods.
ai.safety_notes: - Check the weather forecast and daylight hours before you go. - Wear sturdy footwear and dress in layers; conditions can change quickly on exposed ridges. - Stay on marked paths; follow accessibility and public-rights-of-way signs. - Gates, fences, and livestock may be encountered in rural sections; close gates behind you. - Mobile reception can be limited in parts of the estate; carry a map or offline navigation. - Bring water and a snack; have a small first-aid kit and a basic emergency plan. - Be mindful of other walkers, cyclists, and dogs; control your speed on busier sections.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking boots or shoes with good grip
Map and/or offline GPS (or a downloaded route)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly April to September) generally offers the best conditions for this route, with longer daylight and milder weather. Year-round access is possible, though winter months can bring mud, wind, and shorter days.
